verdict.summary: A thread spawned inside crossbeam::scope panicked, propagating the panic to the parent scope. Handle panics within scoped threads.

dead_ends.action: Use std::panic::catch_unwind at the scope level only
dead_ends.why_fails: catch_unwind on the scope catches the propagated panic but the child thread's state is already corrupted

workarounds.action: Use catch_unwind inside each scoped thread
Use std::thread::scope (Rust 1.63+) which has built-in panic handling

leads_to.condition: When panicked thread drops its channel sender

preceded_by.condition: When Arc unwrap panic occurs inside a scoped thread

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Tokio runtime shutdown is async; crossbeam scope panic is synchronous thread-based concurrency
